description: Alfie May inspires runaway leaders Birmingham to a huge win against 10-man Barnsley in League One at St Andrew's.
title: Birmingham City 6-2 Barnsley
maintext:
Birmingham City have won each of their last two league games against Barnsley and will be looking to win three in succession for the first time since November 2006.
Barnsley have won four of their last seven away league games against Birmingham City (D1 L2), scoring 12 goals in total across those four victories.
Birmingham are unbeaten across their last eight league games against sides from Yorkshire (W5 D3), winning each of the last five in succession. The Blues last enjoyed a longer winning run against sides from the county between December 1984 and May 1985 (six wins).
